question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct about the recently launched National Nutrition Mission (NNM)?
  1. Aadhaar card is a mandatory requirement to avail the benefits of the mission.
  2. It aims to eradicate anaemia among young children, women and adolescent girls completely by 2018.
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation: First statement is correct Government has made Aadhaar card mandatory to avail the benefits of the mission. Second statement is incorrect It aims to bring down anaemia among young children, women and adolescent girls by three per cent per year. NNM will be rolled out in three phases from 2017-18 to 2019-20. NNM targets to reduce stunting, under-nutrition, anemia (among young children, women and adolescent girls) and reduce low birth weight by 2%, 2%, 3% and 2% per annum respectively. It also aims to bring down anaemia among young children, women and adolescent girls by three per cent per year. At the heart of the mission is the use of information communication technology to monitor the implementation of the scheme.
